alert.note: Alert for Craig; Creek; Mayes; Nowata; Osage; Rogers; Tulsa; Wagoner; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 8:00PM CDT until July 15 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, Craig, Creek, Mayes, Nowata, Osage, Rogers, Tulsa, Wagoner and Washington OK. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 759 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Estimates of up to 1 inch of rain have already fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Sand Springs... Claremore... Pryor... Owasso... Bixby... Sapulpa... Jenks... Glenpool... Coweta... Pryor Creek... Skiatook... Catoosa... Collinsville... Verdigris... Chouteau... Chelsea... Inola... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Craig; Creek; Mayes; Nowata; Osage; Rogers; Tulsa; Wagoner; Washington
